intro: Lachemilla adscendens, commonly known as the ascending stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, producing showy pink or purple blooms that attract pollinators. Lachemilla adscendens is well adapted to rocky and alpine habitats, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
